website_summaries.verdict: A practical, no-frills dive watch with classic styling that comes at a fraction of the price of the competition. Despite the minor cons, it's a great choice for the budget-minded buyer.
pros: A well-made dive watch at a very affordable price that resists water to a depth of 656'
Stainless steel and black 44 mm bezel on black resin strap provides a stylish, sporty look
Illuminating hands can be seen in most low-light conditions
Has earned praise for keeping accurate time
cons: Feels somewhat heavy on the wrist
Battery life varies, and some owners received watches that needed batteries replaced shortly after purchase

customer_reviews.title: professional diver's opinion
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this watch. Cost and effectiveness is perfect. You aren't diving below 660-FT, no, you are not. So for $44 you get a watch that works, works well, takes a beating and can be replaced for 1/10 the cost of Seiko, or 1/100 the cost of a Rolex. This thing is BOMB-PROOF! The watch is ALWAYS the first thing to get hit, scraped or broken on a job. When you retire, buy a Seiko, tell everyone who asks about the amazing deep sea diver you once were and be glad you didn't waste money on an expensive watch that looks like the Seiko until you finished diving for good.
customer_reviews.author: will crow

customer_reviews.title: Great value for features and price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for features and price. But I had two reliability problems. First, it began leaking water after a few months of swimming in the pool. I sent it back for warranty repair (the shipping and return shipping cost were one half the cost of the original watch), but it continued leaking (but it continued working). Second, after one year the adjustment dial on the right side just popped off (daylight savings time). Now the time is wrong and it can't be adjusted, and it has water inside the dial). Believe it or not, I'm going to buy another one and give them another chance.
customer_reviews.author: A. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: 22 mm LUG WIDTH!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WATCH DESCRIPTION IS MISLEADING: Great watch for the money. I didn't like the strap so I needed to get a new one, but I found that the watch description is misleading. It says the "band" is 20mm wide, which may be true-ish... but the LUG WIDTH IS 22MM - and that is need-to-know info when you're buying a new band. So you will need a 22 mm band if you want to buy a new one for this watch. Other than that, it's a great watch. It looks really good and has just about everything you need from a good diver. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewSki

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and comfort of the watch
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and comfort of the watch...but will not keep time. I've had it only a few months. I got fast, then went slow, then fast again, then slow and the other day it stopped altogether. WOULD be a great product at a great price...if it worked. Not much good as a TIMEPIECE if it doesn't keep time!!
customer_reviews.author: Reechkeesh

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: one of the best bang for the buck watches out there. Beautiful watch, and the strap that it comes with is comfortable, and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL COZZI

customer_reviews.title: Great return on investment
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars, not 5, because the band irritated my wrist due to it feeling more like a wide rubber band. Still, for the price, this is a very well made watch. The lumin on the bezel is off just slightly, so the marker is dead on, but the lumin painted on it is just offset, and is only noticeable when looking at the lumin face when it's dark. Oh, the lumin will last 4-5 hours IF you have acquired your night vision. If you haven't, the lumin is unreadable in the dark within 40-50 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch good weight, very accurate, easy to read and comfortable to wear. Changed the rubber strap though.
customer_reviews.author: Azyez

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest deal on a dive watch that i've come across
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest deal on a dive watch that i've come across. I paid $44 for this watch and it's as nice or nicer than much more expensive dive watches. This is my second as I dropped the first face down on my concrete garage floor and the crystal shattered. That was totally my fault. This isn't a g shock with a plastic face, so you have to be careful banging it up. But the band is fine. I'm a chiropractor and the band is flexible enough that i keep it on while I'm adjusting patients. I get complimented on it more than any other watch. A total win
customer_reviews.author: DrBones

customer_reviews.title: Bought the hype and love it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a beater watch but it had to be good looking. I didn’t want anything larger than 42mm but I figured this Casio would be a solid choice. After reading reviews and viewing pictures online, I decided this was the right choice especially under $50. I knew I wouldn’t like the rubber band so I bought a gray leather band to put on as soon as I got the watch. I love the look. It doesn’t wear like a large watch does. It’s comfortable and at 12mm, it’s not too thick and doesn’t stick out. My omega speedy is top dog in my collection but this one is top in my daily/beater/do all watch.
customer_reviews.author: ksaddler

customer_reviews.title: Great looking casual watch.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking casual watch. Comfortable adjustable rubber watch band. Easy to read analog style dial and I like the date window feature. I live near the beach so the fact that it’s water resistant to 200 meters is nice. I wear it as a daily work watch. It seems to be keeping time very accurately. For under $50, I think it’s a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A simply phenomenal product for the price. It looks and feels excellent and like real quality. The bezel has a great solid feel and tactile click to it making it great for use when timing in many situations. The screw down crown and very good water resistance is a great bonus too. Mine has so far dived to around 12m with no problems. I run mine on NATO straps as although the rubber strap is very functional I don't really like how it looks. I'm also planning o pick up a stainless steel bracelet for mine. Excellent product and highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Dane Boulton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for a dive watch
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for 10 days now and it is amazingly accurate - +1 second over 10 days. The lumination is not bad at all, either. Sure, it's not as bright as an Omega or other high end watches with tritium, but in complete darkness you can make out the time. My watch is perfect in every way, from the polishing of the stainless steel to the second hand ticking right on every mark. The bezel rotates smoothly, with no backlash whatsoever. I like the band, too, which is practical and tough. My Omega Seamaster 2254.50, on average, is about +2 seconds per day. The Casio keeps far better time for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: BMR

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I have a decent history with Casio and so far my experience has been great with the brand. I purchased this watch for vacation, needing it to take the place of a fairly expensive watch, which I want to keep protected and used for very formal occasions. This watch is fantastic for many reasons. Firstly, with this watch, I am not out hundreds of dollars if this watch becomes beaten up. I can easily purchase another one. Secondly, the build quality is amazing. With its waterproof and beastly characteristics, I am not concerned about having to babysit this watch because anything you throw at it, it will take.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Simple but classic look. Excellent Amazon customer service to fix an issue.
customer_reviews.text: When I initially received this watch, I could not pull the crown out to set the time. I noted that a few other one star ratings had the same issue. I started the return process and Amazon has an option to speak with a representative. The lady I spoke to put me on hold and finally determined that if I turn the crown counter clockwise to loosen it, just like unscrewing something, it became loose and usable. Now the crown is easy to pull out and push back in and the time is set. I’ve started with a four star rating and I’ll update this overtime as I see how well the watch performs.
customer_reviews.author: David J

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value, Solid Performance, No Worry Set and Forget
customer_reviews.text: This watch is pleasing in both looks and price. For less than $45 you get a classic style dependable dive watch. Since I refuse to spend my savings on a Rolex Submariner I got this Casio and I am quite pleased with my decision. I am happy that I can wear this watch all the time, wash my hands and take a shower, even go snorkeling or hang gliding. This watch keeps on going like the Ever- Ready Bunny. I have also banged this timepiece against the kitchen sink and the thing keeps on ticking indefinitely. Please give it a try. What have you got to lose but your selfish pride?
customer_reviews.author: AZ McLennon

customer_reviews.title: best value to date
customer_reviews.text: a respectable diver. not a better deal on the market. very legible. attractive. similar to a seiko or citizen at a fraction of the price. the band is the least among the components offered, but doable and not uncomfortable. but it is a heavy watch, understandable since they would use more affordable materials. im too old now to read the date window with any efficiency, but its there if you need it. for any watch lover on a budget or just a horrology nut this should be in your rotation or collection.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER Casio piece of cheap junk.
customer_reviews.text: This is now THE THIRD Casio watch I have returned to Amazon in as many attempts. AGAIN the date function does not work. I can't believe it. Again the watch was shipped IN AN ENVELOPE and as usual the CHEAP PAPER THIN box it was in was damaged. Just stay away from these junk watches as it is not worth the hassle of waiting for them and then returning them to Amazon. I am mad as hell about the crap being sold,the crap shipping and the hoops they make me jump through now THREE TIMES IN A ROW.
customer_reviews.author: Nutty Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Whats the difference between this watch and a rolex submariner? Thousands of dollars and the casio keeps better time. Of course ten years from now the rolex will be worth thousands more, and the casio will still be a 50 dollar watch. But if you want a watch rather than an investment, buy the casio.
customer_reviews.author: Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Best sub-$50 diver and maybe the best sub-$50 watch.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly dare you to find a better 200m WR diver with a rotating bezel and screw down crown for under $50. The Duro might be the best sub-$50 watch in general. The quartz movement is accurate, and ticks in-line with the second markers, no off-set second hand here. Its smart looking and but rugged. Its an excellent beater and i do a lot of fishing, hiking, camping, and hunting and this is my new go to watch to bring with me. Only complaint is the lumes but honestly, for a sub-$50 diver, its a dumb complaint. Casio has done it again and proved to me that it is no slouch in the watch game.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I watched a couple reviews of this piece before buying and they rated it very highly. This watch is great, especially for the price. It's quality is up there with 250 dollar dive watches. I did put a nato strap on it, however I will swap the original one on when I am swimming. I often hike the 4k footers in New Hampshire and this watch should be perfect for that as I always end up swimming during or after my hikes. I've included a pic of the original strap and the NATO put on. This nato came in a package of 6 that I bought on Amazon for 13 dollars FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Bad glass quality
customer_reviews.text: This watch has a very soft glass; it got completely scratched in a couple of weeks, but for no reason. It seems just the fabric of my shirt would scratch it
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: My goto utility watch
customer_reviews.text: Amazon says I purchased 5 of these watches over the last two years. I keep buying them because the watches are awesome. I've given them away. I've beat the daylights out of them. I keep one, unworn, on my work area just because I like the dial. Solid watch. I started swimming at the gym as an exercise to ease some back pain and I wear this watch while I swim - then into a hot tub - then into the shower. Great watch. C'mon. Look at the price. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cardone

customer_reviews.title: Too much
customer_reviews.text: This watch was too big and too heavy for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morton

customer_reviews.title: This is a greatwatch. Looks really good and have nothing bad ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome watch!! I have nothing bad to say about it, no complains. I switch it up every now and then with a different strap, Sometimes I'll put it on a nato sometimes i'll put it on a metal bracelet. Highly recommend this watch, i'll doubt you find something better for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Definitely bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for a few weeks now and it has been worn as my EDC watch ever since. For the money it definitely does the job you need it to - keeping time. There are a few pros and cons though which I will list below: Pros: - Easy to read - Screw down crown works perfectly fine - Bezel rotates as easily as you'd want it to - Strap is comfortable considering the material Cons: - My bezel shakes a little when you tap the 6 o'clock position - Lume is pretty weak
customer_reviews.author: Paul F.

customer_reviews.title: Best Next to a Rolex Submariner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch. Very well made and as good or better than what I was issued by the Navy. Bought for my son's 10 BD, while the size and weight are a bit on the large and heavy side right now he loves it and I don't have to worry about it getting wet. Case is a clone of the Rolex submariner and Tudor dive watches. Casio has a great reputation for keeping good time and durability. I wanted to buy him a tank for a watch and he's got one now!
customer_reviews.author: mudbonedad

customer_reviews.title: No luminance
customer_reviews.text: I've spear fished wearing this watch with no leaks. I wasnt at depth, just snorkeling and looking for dinner. I havent worn it yet with the pressure of deeper water. It does have a screw down crown and I no longer see that in the description but is probably why many reviews say they couldnt set the watch. For the price, so far it's worth the money. The luminescent part is a problem. If you leave it under a lamp all day it still loses the luminescence after dark. I wouldnt trust that diving unless you get one better made.
customer_reviews.author: Kingslayer

customer_reviews.title: Easily Damaged/Not Durable at all
customer_reviews.text: The watch was fine until I took it off my wrist and it fell to the floor. The face of the watch shattered. Glass all inside the front of the watch. It no longer works. I only had it for about 45 days. I thought this was suppose to be a durable watch. Mind you, it just fell to the floor and shattered. Unbelievable!! Guess I’ll try to find a more durable brand that can take a small licking and keep on ticking.
customer_reviews.author: Snow White

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch
customer_reviews.text: I received the 1st one and it was broken. I notified customer service and they resolved the matter VERY quickly. This is a great watch. It looks really nice. I've only had it about a month and I've already received a few compliments on it. The only complaint is the day (date) is not easy to read, especially if you are getting a little older and wear readers or glasses. The font is very thin.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Had high hopes, dashed by tiny window
customer_reviews.text: I had read a lot of great reviews of this watch, on and off Amazon, so I took the plunge and bought one to use as a daily beater watch. But I can only say that while the watch itself seems solid and will probably work as promised the teeny tiny calendar window Casio decided to put on this watch makes it near unusable to me and to others who need a quick date reference. I mean, they are ridiculously small numerals. Other watches at least put a magnifier on the crystal but not this Casio. I know it's not a deal-breaker for a lot of people but it was for me.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiMe

customer_reviews.title: The perfect watch at a great price
customer_reviews.text: So my $20 Casio plastic divers watch died after three years about a month ago, and I loved it. I wore it everyday for the most part (I do have some vintage dress watches), but the the battery died and it was a little beat up. When I got this watch, I wasn't exactly thrilled with the resin band, so I purchased a stainless steel bracelet and now I wear this watch daily. Very good looking. Best $60 I have ever spent on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: M. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Quality watch for an absurdly good price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, there's really zero real complaint. The date window is difficult to see at a glance but other than that, for an inexpensive dive watch to sort of "dress" things up on the fly, this really can't be beat. The bezel action while not on par with Grand Seiko, Orient, or Casio's more expensive models, is still really good, positive, and takes a little bit of tug to get some back play. Probably just a weak bezel spring. It sits nice on the wrist and really looks about $100 higher than it's price point yet, I wouldn't mind too much if I lost it or wrecked it.
customer_reviews.author: Topher C

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for a scuba class
customer_reviews.text: Casio hit another homerun. Nothing compares with this watch at this price. Perfect for a diving course or snorkeling on vacation. People don't really wear a Rolex or this watch if they're really diving. They wear a Seiko! If your serious about your watersports I suggest you also pick up an SKX007 or SKX009 while they are still available. Both are discontinued but stock remains. The Casio Duro is the watch you wear for a scuba class at your local junior college. No great loss if and when it meets it's demise on the concrete or ladder. Face is plain, dial is too big...but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Lar Bear

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch that wears like a much more expensive one
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of watches and have plenty of divers. This one is a heck of a bargain. It's light for its size, has a super clear display. It has a locking screw for time and date adjustment and is nice to look at. Honestly, I've spent 4 times this on a Luminox and think this is a better watch. The one draw back is that the hands and dial don't glow bright or for very long, even with 6 hours of sun exposure. That said - for under 50 bucks this is my new go-to kitchen and knock around outdoor watch. Really a stellar bargain!
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: A very pleasant and affordable surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I'd heard many great things about this watch although didn't think it could be that nice at this low of price. I was wrong. I'm not saying its worth hundreds or thousands of dollars, but its amazingly well made and I get many compliments and admiring glances from people while wearing it...especially after adding the gingerbread colored watch strap from the guys at Barton watch straps (also purchased via Amazon) see pics below. I have dozens of watches that I buy/sell /trade/collect...And in my opinion, if you can only own one watch and your $$ is limited, this needs to be it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: Rolex killer
customer_reviews.text: BEST watch I ever owned. I think I originally got a wonky battery. It died 3 times in the two years I've had it and now it is really dead. Needed a new band about a year in. The bezel is scratched up a lot and needed to be thicker than the glass to protect it. If your bezel sticks out further than your face it protects it better. I would buy another one. But I don't​ have to. When it's working it is always dead nuts on. Got a new battery and now it is just fine. Always on time.
customer_reviews.author: TODD R CASPELL

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: The watch was seemingly glued to the stand did not come off easily. The dial to change the date and time has been jammed into the watch making it pretty much useless. After several attempts, we could not "unstick" the dial. I'll be returning and making sure not to purchase from this vendor again. Update.. They sent me another watch and it was defective too. This is not a legitimate watch. I sincerely wish Amazon would do a better job at monitoring what people are allowed to sell here.
customer_reviews.author: Claire E Koenes

customer_reviews.title: Great budget watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great budget diver watch. I have seen more expensive watches with less water resistance. I have owned this for a week and wore it daily. I had to change the cheap plastic band out for a AlphaShark NATO. I didn’t like the feeling of the plastic band. There’s a nice weight to it. Worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The product meets the expectations. It has the correct description, what I did not like is the packaging. The box arrived very damaged and broken, happily the product very well
customer_reviews.author: Jean Carlo Ortiz Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Really nice but I’m fat and doesn’t fit me well
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a Seiko for a fraction of the price! Nice looking! Only thing is that because it is heavy, it has a tendency to shift/rotate slightly on your wrist. Maybe my wrist is the wrong size, the watch is too tight if I don’t want it to shift. If comfortable, it shifts. Maybe if I listen to my doctor and lose weight, this watch will fit better and not shift. Hah! Who am I kidding? My lighter resin case Casio stays put and I don’t need to listen to my doctor! Gave this watch to my dad. Still a nice watch.
customer_reviews.author: Tim808

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Dive Watch, Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY what I've been looking for! - ANALOG only good dive watch. Just got back from Bonaire, This watch took several 100+ft dives with me, NO problem whatsoever. Good time. Highly recommended. Good Job, Casio! IMO, Casio has ALWAYS made high quality dive watches. Most, however, have digital readouts or combination analog and digital. I don't like the combo's. The digital portion is basically a separate time device that requires setting the digital portion everytime you change the analog portion. I LIKE analog, I can read it with my aging eyes easily underwater without pressing any buttons! I've been diving for years. I LOVE this watch, DOUBLE LOVE it for the price / quality!
customer_reviews.author: A. Zacher

customer_reviews.title: Good value with minor issues.
customer_reviews.text: This is a durable, large, heavy, masculine watch best suited for a larger wrist. If reading time in the dark is important to you, the luminous hands and indicators are very weak. Casio should have given this watch their Illuminator system instead. The date window is difficult to read without a magnifier in the crystal. I would have preferred a high contrast second hand again for visibility but the hour and minute hands are just right. It's not my everyday watch but a good addition to my collection. Overall, it's still a good value and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: DDogg

customer_reviews.title: Leaky dive watch
customer_reviews.text: Like most things these used to be good watches but...... Mine got water inside of it after taking a few showers while wearing it. Some dive watch. I may have just got a lemon but I'm not taking a second chance.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect budget vacation watch
customer_reviews.text: What a value this watch is. My Seiko diver solar battery died while not being exposed to the sun at all during Coronavirus lockdown, and I needed a watch for a vacation that was water resistant and looked good enough to wear out to dinner. There are plenty of options for that, but if you want something cheap enough that you won’t mind potentially betting getting beat up from whatever you are doing...this is a perfect watch. It looks good...not flashy, but it’s a handsome watch. It has a rubber wrist strap which is great when you know you are going to get it wet during the day. I’m loving this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Pete C

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING: Water permeates during surf session
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not anything close to the 300m depth rating they claim... Still works fine, surprisingly enough. Just unfortunate that whenever I check the time, these water droplets remind me that my purchase didn't live up to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best diver for the money, no question.
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch about 8 years ago for a diving/sailing trip to French Polynesia. I have a couple much, much more expensive divers that I did not want to risk traveling with or losing to the bottom of the ocean (it happens!) This thing is a tank! I've beaten it up for eight years, wear it on every dive, snorkel, boat outing, tons of travel, desert, hiking, you name it. Never fogged and surprisingly resistant to scratches. Changed the battery a few times myself and I'm on my third strap. Will never die. I just bought another one as a birthday present for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandrowzl, Barrerasff! @

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfecct
customer_reviews.text: This watch is almost perfect. Everything about it is fantastic, especially for the price. BUT. The lume is garbage. It's completely useless. If you can relume this watch do it! Other than that if you don't really care about lume this watch is fantastic and it takes straps REALLY well. !*EDIT!*: I forgot to mention I need to dock a star because when I received the watch from the shipper the box was completely mangled. The watch works perfectly fine since Casio knows how to build a solid product, but if you can order this from any other shipper or find it in a retail store, DO IT.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Watch
customer_reviews.text: Good watch that is comfortable and stands up to rough and wet wear well. Strap is large enough for larger wrist. Easy to read in daylight. Only knock I have is (as others have mentioned) the glow in dark function is short lived. Waking up in the middle of the night when camping requires getting a light out to see what time it is. Keeps pretty good time. Seems to lose a couple of minutes per month, which for a non-internet connected/ non-cellular device isn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jimerson

customer_reviews.title: Classic!
customer_reviews.text: Just so happy with this purchase! Great look. Classic and simple. Seems versatile fashion wise. I also bought some Ritchie NATO straps to keep it looking fresh with any outfit. The bezel is sturdy and has a satisfying click to each turn. The face is clear as well as the date. The strap isn’t horrible but I did see reviews from some watch aficionados that said an upgrade would do it some good. Such an affordable and respected watch I had to start my collection right here!
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: A truly special budget watch
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing watch! For the price, I honestly don't think there is a better diving style watch. It's beautiful, sturdy and reliable. I have had this watch for several years. It has survived 24 hour shifts on the ambulance and working in the ER. I just recently replaced the battery and it's good to go. After banging the crystal on walls and various other things it has some scratches but that's expected. Just recently bought a new strap as the original has started to crack. You will not be disappointed by this quality watch.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Depoy

customer_reviews.title: What a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, is it any surprise that this watch has a combined 4.5-star rating for nearly 1800 reviews? At less than $50, this is a fantastic watch! Is it perfect? No. So does it deserve a 5-star rating? Damn right. I haven't seen anything at this price-point get this close to perfection. I wish it was a bit smaller, but even on my 6.25" wrist, thanks to the lug-to-lug distance it still sits without any overhang..but it's definitely at my limit. The MDV-106 really makes you question how on Earth any other company can honestly justify charging hundreds, let alone thousands, for a watch unless it is absolutely, unequivocally perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Theo Scheepers

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy, but it’s a diver that gets the job done. Great daily watch.
customer_reviews.author: José

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This watch looks great, more than I expected versus the price paid. Have not tested the waterproofness of it but trust it enough to go swimming or shower with it on (check YouTube). I actually bought it as a work watch but decided I like it too much to get it scratched up at work. Highly recommended. Only negative is the band. Not my style and plan to switch out. It’s perfectly functioning though and not an issue if you like it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded to the miltat super oyster 2 curved bracelet
customer_reviews.text: Solid feel and build. I purchased this watch to see the legitimacy of wearing a diver daily before I buy an upgrade. That being said, I have no qualms with this timepiece. Crystal has proved scratch resistant for everyday wear (gym, ocean, vehicle maintenance). It has kept time to within 1 second for a month duration that I have been monitoring it. I upgraded to the miltat super oyster 2 curved bracelet. I was able to use the small Casio pins to effectively secure the band. Overall, this watch has been worth the meager price.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelai_5

customer_reviews.title: Had to get another one
customer_reviews.text: My second version of this watch. The first lasted 6+ years of hard use. Add I've aged my work is less physical so I how this lasts longer. I receive many comments on the refined look of this watch. At this price, if I lost it, I'd buy another one. The band is longer than normal, to fit over a dive suit. This may help those of us with more sizable wrists. Great watch and long lasting. Buy one, and you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is very very nice for the price. The watch case feels high quality - no sharp edges like a quartz tag for 20 times the price that I checked out at an airport duty free shop recently. The case and bezel (not including the crown) feel like they could easily be from a $1000+ watch. The band feels a little cheap but is comfortable. Crown feels a bit delicate. I may at some point buy a different strap for it. But overall a really really nice dive watch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Z

customer_reviews.title: You cannot beat this Watch!
customer_reviews.text: This might just be my favorite watch. It is definitely my everyday driver. I've put this watch through every condition imaginable for two years, and it still looks like it just came out of the box. Construction, Demo,Swim, Surf.... I have beaten this watch like it owes me money.. Never varies more than 2-4 seconds a month!! And less than $50 bucks... Finish and fit are astounding at this price... the second hand precisely lines with every tick.. I love my Seiko's, and Hamilton and other pricier watches, but this one blows me away for it's quality, especially at this price-point. I dare you to find another actual dive watch for less than $150. My congratulations to Casio ...
customer_reviews.author: Danphred

customer_reviews.title: The very most for my money .
customer_reviews.text: In life we are happy if something we buy meets our expectations , buy there are those time that you can count on one hand when you are incredibly happy, we’ll just let me say this if you think I might work for Casio or something, I am A minister, and you couldn’t pay me to do that. Honestly, for what it cost and what I bought, I bought 2 of them, based on A U Tube promo, now I am very happy I did, they are beautiful, and one will be A gift for my grandson. God Bless, Brother Jim.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very nice watch
customer_reviews.text: For a relatively inexpensive price, this watch is great. Solid stainless steel, screw-down crown; quite accurate. Luminous hands,indices and bezel marker. The one-way rotating bezel is the best one I have ever used...small "clicks" for precision, solid and not loose at all but still very smooth and easy to use...one way ratchet. I got a crystal protector and put it on (like I do for all of my watches) and I find myself wearing this watch all the time. It is also a nice design and looks like a much more expensive watch.
customer_reviews.author: Porker

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it’s ridiculously low price
customer_reviews.text: There are so many positive reviews about this watch that it made me want to buy one. Especially at its ridiculously reasonable price. I have owned it for about a week and I love it. Keeps good time and looks beautiful. I put a red band on it as a sort of joke tribute to Shark tank host Kevin O’Leary. Mr. O’Leary invests in luxury watches and always puts a red band on them. I found the band on Amazon and it also received excellent reviews. The red band really makes this watch pop. 👍
customer_reviews.author: MarkM007

customer_reviews.title: Check it ASAP
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I bought this Casio in order to have a back up in July. Open it up and could not pull out the crown to set the watch and then I used a little more pressure with a screw driver and it came out all together. Watch fell a part and they lost me for good. If you buy this watch open it up ASAP and check so you can return it. GOOD LUCK!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason that this watch has over 1,700 reviews and a 4+ star rating. At this price point I believe it's the best diver watch you can buy that actually functions as a diver, not just looks like one! I bought the watch for versatility and it's ability to look good on a variety of bands so to help any of you I've included pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Dirty little secret
customer_reviews.text: Here is something I didn't realize about these Casio watches. ALL of these digital watches keep better time than ANY mechanical chronometers, including Rolex. I reset mine to time.gov when daylight saving ended and so far it has lost one second. I like the dive watch style because I don't need to time my exercise to the second, and the watch face is very easy to see. It is visible somewhat in the dark, too. The one-way rotating bezel is smooth. If you don't think of your watch as jewelry, but mainly as a timepiece, this works great. And, several people have thought at first glance it was a Rolex, which is amusing.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Tramdack

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great looks
customer_reviews.text: A good-looking watch, at a very reasonable price.Looks very similar to the Rolex Submariner. A quartz watch than can be hacked, able to have the second hand stopped, when you need to synchronize it. One down side to this watch is the edge of the bezel. It is difficult to rotate the bezel, due to the edge, not being sharp enough to get a good grip on it, and to the stiffness of the turning of the bezel.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Rider

customer_reviews.title: Casio MDV 106 dive watch
customer_reviews.text: Just received the watch and found that the bezel does not rotate as advertised. I called Casio tech support and was told that there are two versions of this watch with the same model number and one has a rotating bezel and one does not. And no way to determine which watch you will receive and I wanted a rotating bezel. It does not make sense to me as the watch I received says that it has a rotating bezel on the watch box. But other than that the watch is very nice, well constructed with nice fit and finish and so far has kept excellent time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little watch. Wanted a knock around dive watch to throw a NATO strap on for a more casual look. The watch is heavy and substantial feeling. The bezel is functional and a nice tight click to it. The size is big but not distracting. It’s noticeably bigger than my orient mako USA II. I love the quartz movement it’s just always on time! I’m looking forward to getting a lot of great use out of this watch
customer_reviews.author: Dan Falcortez

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: First dive watch, was lookin at way more expensive watches first, looked at just about every dive option out there and got this one. I love it, fits perfectly on my 7 1/4in wrist. The hands, dial, & bezel all line up and fall perfectly witch I was real nervous about at this price point. Strap is alright but crap but that’s a easy change. Lume is there but not great. Bezel feels and clicks nicely. If Casio put a sapphire crystal and better lume I would gladly pay double. Love the clean balanced look of the dial. Highly recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional men's watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to get a nice men's watch for a while now and could not decide which watch would be a good pick. I had finally decided on the Casio because I had one many years ago and got good service with it. When it came I was somewhat disappointed because the case was a little thicker than what I like but after have it for 3 months now I am very satisfied with my selection. I don't think you could get a better men's watch for less than $50. Keeps perfect time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS WATCH!!!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I’d buy a Casio. I’m expanding my watch collection and this got really good reviews. I’ve bought forty dollar watches when I first began and never wore them. Too cheap! But this watch is an actual dive watch. With weight to it, but not too heavy. I switched out the band with an army green , canvas, quick release and it looks like a $200 watch easy. This watch is durable!!! It will last for a long time and take a beating. I do all my watch work myself so I have some useful experience and I’m telling you get this watch while you can!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.text: Everything is exactly as advertised... or implied. The watch is attractive, tough, functional, stylish, and it keeps accurate time (whatever that actually is). If you buy one, you likely will not be disappointed. It's a good watch. I'm happy with mine. That all adds up to its being an adequate, but not spectacular, watch in the hyped-up world market. But foremost, does anybody really know what time it is?
customer_reviews.author: Keneau Arnet

customer_reviews.title: Time keeper
customer_reviews.text: Casio does a very nice job with this model, easily read face, I could stand the black to be more of a matte finish but I take it that can be difficult to do, but this one is not TOO shiny Time keeping wise it is spot on, very nice in that regard. I had ordered a replacement strap and a deployant clasp at the same time I ordered the watch, but if I had held and worn it first, I would have waited, as the band that arrives is comfortable. so the strap in my photo is a padded leather one from DeBeers, also very nice ;-) G2
customer_reviews.author: G2 in Painted Post NY

customer_reviews.title: Died in 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Sat in drawer until yesterday. I took it out and put a NATO band on it, with hopes at wearing this weekend. No such luck; dead. Likely cheap Chinese batteries, instead of past Japanese ones. Disappointing. Now my $45 watch will cost another $20 (for me to get the battery installed).
customer_reviews.author: W. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great watch at any price-- under $50 is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This would be a beautiful watch at any price. As good-looking and tough as watches costing hundreds more. The included strap looks good and is great for water sports, but I added a striped NATO strap, comfortable and durable and quick-drying. Swam with this all weekend and am incredibly pleased with it. Very glad I found it before buying a nearly identical one for almost $400. The date window is small, but so is the one on a renowned $10k swiss model, and I don't think a date magnifier would be an improvement to the clean looks here. The illumination is initially bright but doesn't last. Otherwise, a beautiful, rugged watch and would be a cool gift.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: BEST BUDGET WATCH MONEY CAN BUY
customer_reviews.text: works extremely well! i wear it daily and took it camping + work + everywhere. It's amazing and the rotating bezel feels sturdy. This is by far the best budget watch you can buy. i added an aftermarket strap just to add to the functionality + style but the watch itself is amazing. I wish there was a chronograph version of this watch though :)
customer_reviews.author: mahmoud

customer_reviews.title: But this watch! You'll thank me later!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! Stainless steel case, crown guards, accurate movement, etc. Great for people with failing old age eyesight. Also, if your wrists are on the girly side like mine, still fits very well. Perfect for any activity.Take it hunting, fishing, diving, and it won't let you down .Just don't wear it to your grandmother's funeral. Plus, if the watch is lost or damaged it doesn't cost a small fortune to replace it. I've owned many watches at many price points, but this is the best value of any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice watch and economical. It resembles a much more expensive watch. I had someone mistake it for the expensive one. I have had it on SCUBA dives up to 30 feet so far. They don't recommend it for some reason but if it is really water resistant to 600+ feet, it should be OK. It is a nice size. The night glow is OK but not super visible. The date is hard to read. It needs one of those magnifying windows in the crystal. The one-way bezel works well. The detents hold but not too hard to turn. So far, not a single scratch on the crystal in daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Waynemia

customer_reviews.title: Good $30 Watch
customer_reviews.text: Big face makes for quick and easy reading. Bezel does not rotate smoothly nor easily. Have been diving for over 30 years so know how the bezel shout operate. Might have received the one in 10,000 that is out of speck. The watch does take a beating though as evidenced by the two broken pins already.
customer_reviews.author: m ness

customer_reviews.title: Bullet Proof
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch almost three years ago and its still keeping great time. During that three years I've used it while: in field work for local water dept, regular weed wacking large areas of undergrowth, cycling, taking showers, swimming,and daily office work wear. I've changed the watch pins twice, and the battery one. The lens if now pretty scratched up, but it's still easy to see through. I'm going to see how long this lasts, or till I cant see the time through the crystal anymore, and then I will buy another. great watch!
customer_reviews.author: kurt d

customer_reviews.title: SCRATCHES
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn this watch a few times but noticed there are scratches all over the face of the watch... Looks like I was sent a used watch! Tried to send a picture but was unable to
customer_reviews.author: Phymci

customer_reviews.title: New work watch.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to replace an old Invicta that I have been wearing everyday for work the last 12 years (Construction) (see pics) The old Invicta is scratched, faded, and the crystal has been cracked a couple of times but the dam thing keeps going so the reason I am replacing it is the band will not stay locked anymore and comes loose. I looked at new bands but for what I paid on this new Casio I figured I would give it a try. It is a very nice looking watch hope it holds up...
customer_reviews.author: Jungle Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to replace my old scarred up MDV-102. It arrived yesterday (a day ahead of schedule - good job Amazon) and I was very pleasantly surprised. First of all, this watch seems a little lighter than the old MDV-102, and the band is much more comfortable. Secondly, I like the fact that the crystal doesn't have the pronounced "dome" that the 102 has, perhaps it'll be a little easier for me to keep from scratching the crystal so much. I realize that just a little over 24 hours may be too soon to objectively judge the accuracy of this watch, but so far it's spot on. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Sides

customer_reviews.title: Great Everyday Watch
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one for wearing EXPENSIVE jewelry or watches just because I get into lots of shenanigans and having something that is going to definitely be roughed up or see adventure, ruggedness is a must. Being scared if my wrist hits something is not my cup of tea. I like a watch that can be fine dressed up or dressed down. This takes the cake in terms of looking great, having amazing durability and affordable cost. I gave this 4 stars just because I received one that had DUST under the mineral crystal on the face. If you're a working man, an adventurer, a scuba diver, etc. This watch is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch
customer_reviews.text: Watch looks nice, husband picked it out for his surfing and work needs. Unfortunately it arrive already ticking with that little tab pulled out. Soooo, we had no idea how long it may have sat in the warehouse, been a previous return etc. Called Amazon to return as it stated it was not eligible for return and they credited my account, we don't have to return it! I was quite surprised, their customer service was over and above what I expected. So, we will use the watch for as long as it lasts and hubs is very happy with it in general.
customer_reviews.author: SDRoxyMom

customer_reviews.title: Best watch I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This watch is amazing. I have owned omega, movado, raymond weil, seiko (many) and others. This $45 watch easily outperforms every one of them. Every time we hit a time change due to daylight savings, I test this watch against the atomic clock and find it about 5 seconds off over a six month period. It really is amazing. It often is noticed and people think that it is a very expensive watch. Then they turn their nose up when I tell them its a casio. I'm a lifelong customer.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Casio MDV-106 Best Watch On The Planet !
customer_reviews.text: Love these Casio MDV-106 Duro 200 Meter Dive Watches ! I have four of them, two black, one blue & one gold. I use one of the black ones as a EDC beater and the rest are more for casual nights out on the town. I also dive, fish, ride motorcycles and hunt with them. Never a single problem with any of them. They are solid watches, worth every penny !
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review
customer_reviews.text: My original review stated the hands and numbers were not luminescent, thankfully I was wrong. It must have needed more exposure to light. I woke up this morning and reached for the light switch and thought I was wearing my Sector Divemaster! While it is not as bright as the Sector, it was still clearly seen after a solid 8hrs of darkness. A great watch at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: G69

customer_reviews.title: Fit and Finish!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a few nice watches. I have a few cheap watches. I have three nice cheap watches. THIS Casio is the Jackpot of NICE CHEAP watches! The fit finish function and aesthetics of this watch is amazing! Casio is supposed to be a disposable plastic watch. What this is,,is exceptional value with the look of class and fashion. Get one or don’t get one. Obviously your decision. I put my approval on very few products. I can’t imagine an honest someone claiming this watch fails to meet its intended mark.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen1

customer_reviews.title: Very good watch...
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. I used it, without hesitation, snorkeling on a recent cruise to Cabo and Puerto Vallarta. I wanted to see how tough this Casio is and how dry in fresh and salt water it would stay. Happy to announce, not a drop has appeared inside the watch. The screw down crown is doing it's job and the crystal watch face has resisted scratching or clouding. I plan to acquire 2 more as gifts. I will do business again with this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Randy King

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable value for money
customer_reviews.text: The Watch itself is fantastic value. Pros Great finishing on the case Quiet tick Second hand hits the markers perfectly Bezel action is tight Screw down crown secures tightly and is easy to operate Cons Resin band is average at best but not uncomfortable Lume is good initially but fades quickly. Honestly though at this price there really isn't any better value for money out there. The the about this watch is warranted. Unbeatable value proposition.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley H

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for money. Best beater for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Looks sharp and feels solid. This Casio punches way above its class. 200meter water resistance, unidirectional 120 click bezel and a screw down crown. For the money you just are not going to find a better beater watch. I put the Ritche 22mm Stainless Steel Bracelet on it (fits perfectly to the curved case) and it really dressed this watch up. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, reliable watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful and functional watch. I like it a lot. I prefer having a band that is rubber or leather as the whole watch is lighter and you don't get arm hairs pinched in the metal links. The markers and hands glow in the dark, but I do miss having an "indiglo" button to illuminate the dial. However, that was done to keep it waterproof for diving, I guess. The size / shape is fine too, it is not overly large, I have seen other watches that are larger and thicker. The whole circle looks about the size of a Silver Eagle, I'd guess, but I haven't measured it. I don't have super large wrists or hands either.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value, all the necessary features
customer_reviews.text: This is the lowest priced 200 meter Diver in the Market and it does not disappoint. Stainless steel, screw down crown and caseback, rotating bezel, luminous hands and markers, mineral glass and stem protectors, and resin expansion band complete the package. Excellent watch for those whose everyday activities place them in or near the water, also comfortable and hopefully durable, for daily work wear. I plan to give this watch to my college son who lifeguards, swims, and rows.
customer_reviews.author: Mark OberleTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for outdoor activities (fishing and hunting) about a month ago. So far it has survived being submerged and being in the woods, but it has not faced really rough treatment. It is easy to read the time during daylight, but the numbers for the date are too small. It's luminescence is poor. I replaced the band with one from BluShark -- it's less practical but feels and looks better.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. A.W. Samii

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my boyfriend. He had been looking at some very simular dive watches that were very expensive. I found this one for such a great deal so I got it as a place holder until I can afford a nicer one. He loves it though! Its a very nice watch for the price. It has Japanese movement and beautiful details in the hands. The only downside is that its battery powered. I believe that is what makes the price of this lower than others. Otherwise its a great watch!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice watch
customer_reviews.text: I do like this watch but I wish it was the same as my old one. It had both the light and the screw lock crown. Unfortunately quality and pride in a product are a thing of the past. If I hadn't owned the old one before this one I wouldn't know what I was missing and it wouldn't be so bad. So I probably would have given this watch 5 stars because it really is a nice watch. The old version was nicer though.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Like a smart bomb
customer_reviews.text: The watch is simple, handsome and rugged. Like a smart bomb, you set it and stays on accurate time with a life expectation of 2 to 3 years on a battery. The watch is water proof and easy to read. The watch strap is very good, flexible and can be easily replaced when needed. The price is very good for this durable watch and I will be purchasing three for my two teenage grandsons and Marine Core son.
customer_reviews.author: Earl B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Best $45.99 ever invested in a watch hands down, this Casio Duro is better than expected, very comfortable to wear, looks great and best of all, keeps immaculate timing, no regrets getting this timepiece, it’s a great daily wearer, haven’t tried it under water so I can’t say anything about that but I have no doubt it’ll perform well there too..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Watch Is A Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The Casio "Duro" is a well-known bargain among watch people. I have watches from $ to $$$$ and I still enjoy wearing this Casio frequently. I like the size and the flat crystal - it looks good on my wrist. I shower, wash my car, do dishes and garden with it and it has operated flawlessly. For the price, this is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, but easily scratched crystal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a similar Cadio I lost. Overall am satisfied with this watch, with the exception of the crystal. It scratches super easy. My old Casio was much more scratch resistant, and this new one has accumulated more scratches in 1 month than I did in 5+ years of daily use. Thats why it gets a 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: midwest doc

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous watch and a STEAL!
customer_reviews.text: I've been on a watch kick lately and have slowly been building my collection. This was a watch that I've constantly seen recommended by watch connesieurs for it's looks, durability, and simple functionality. I finally purchased this watch and I cannot be happier! This is STEAL at it's price point and has quickly become be of my favorite daily drivers. Plus it's gorgeous! I recently replaced the rubber band with a NATO one and it totally changed the looks. I cannot recommend this watch more. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: L. AvilaTop Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: Casio Men's MDV106-1AV 200M Duro Analog Watch, Black
feature_bullets: Black Stainless Steel case and Resin Band
Black Dial with date window at 3 O'clock
Luminous markers and hour hands; sweep second hand
